column4: is there any legal info I should know about running ubuntu in a school?
not sure exactly what you're asking.  if you're on your own machine, then you should be able to run whatever OS you want.  Just don't access anything you're not supposed to (i.e. adult websites, etc)
I am planning on installing Ubuntu on ~20 comps at a gradeschool, Daekdroom stated it well, I am going to use it commercially
lspci -nn | grep audio
returns ''
do what greezmunkey says...if you don't see anything that pops out, google the motherboard and see if there's anything you can find on it
not much of a hardware person, where do I find out what motherboard I have
it will show in the lspci
if you need to, post the output to http://paste.ubuntu.com and ask someone to look @ it
http://paste.ubuntu.com/452248/
what do I google, I'm not getting anything with 'sound' or 'audio' in it
will there be anything during boot - just before grub?
sorry, but could you do an lspci -v and paste it for me?
BIOS Version 1.00.02.DH05
BIOS Audio Configuration: http://pastebin.com/Jnkhcja3 - lspci -v coming soon
it may be very long...if you need to, do it this way so it saves to a text file: lspci -v > filename.txt
its done - http://pastebin.com/ny9nGKET = lspci -v
did that say what motherboard I have?
did that say anything about my motherbord?
you still here?
did u look at my pastebin?
I did -- I'm sorry but I wasn't able to find anything
why doesn't my car work?   you need to give details (i.e. error messages, etc)
